could anyone explain https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-4844-shard-blob-transactions/8430/14?u=nibnalin from vitalik? my understanding is that it suggests that given a kzg commitment as public input and an opening as private input it is possible to verify the opening is correct inside a snark without performing a pairing operation? how would this work?
is he actually suggesting that the opening be verified outside the snark in a pairing run outside, generate the opening values and pass them into the snark? if so if there's a large multiopening wouldn't this get inefficient fast?  i suspect there's some PLONK specific trick im missing here
